Description.val:
The FY 2021 funding request was reduced by $0.722 million to account for the availability of prior year execution balances.

The Coast Guard Equipment line funds the Coast Guard Combat System Suite for United States Coast Guard (USCG) cutters under the Coast Guard Surface Asset Acquisition Program.  Under inter-service agreement (delineated in OPNAVINST 4000.79C), DON plans, programs, and budgets for specific Navy military equipment, systems and logistic support requirements for Coast Guard units to ensure the Coast Guard is prepared to execute naval warfare tasks in consonance with US Navy units.  Ship construction and installation costs are funded under the Department of Homeland Security appropriation.

The Combat Systems and Weapons Suite will be aligned with future naval ship building programs to support commonality among the two Service's systems and meet National Fleet objectives.

The Combat System Suite must compliment and integrate with Navy Combat Systems.  The suite is an appropriate balance of equipment to ensure the Coast Guard is prepared to accomplish the assigned Naval Warfare tasks in concert with US Navy units.  The Surface Asset Acquisition Program Combat Suites include the following:

[P40A / CG001 - SPQ-9B RADAR]: Provides the AN/SPQ-9B radar for the Maritime Security Cutter, Large (WMSL) Class, aka the National Security Cutter (NSC), to track surface targets and low fliers in support of potential gun engagements.

[P40A / CG002 IFF AIMS]: Provides the AN/UPX-29A Identification Friend or Foe (IFF) System for the National Security Cutter (NSC), aka the Maritime Security Cutter, Large (WMSL), and the Offshore Patrol Cuter (OPC) Class, aka the Maritime Security Cutter, Medium (WMSM).  The AN/APX-123 Transponder is procured for the Fast Response Cutter (FRC) aka Patrol Coastal Cutter (WPC).

[P40A / CG003 DECOYS MK 53]: Provides the MK 53 Mod 6 Decoy Launching System (DLS) for the National Security Cutter (NSC), aka the Maritime Security Cutter, Large (WMSL), and the Offshore Patrol Cuter (OPC) Class, aka the Maritime Security Cutter, Medium (WMSM) to provide soft-kill capability.

[P40A / CG004 SLQ-32]: Provides the AN/SLQ-32 Electronic Warfare System and the Battle Force Electronic Warfare Trainer (BEWT) for the National Security Cutter (NSC) Class, aka the Maritime Security Cutter, Large (WMSL), to perform Electronic Support Measures to support soft-kill measures.

[P40A / CG005 MK 46/MK 20 OPTICAL SIGHT]: Provides the MK 46 Mod 1 Optical Sighting System (OSS) for the National Security Cutter, hulls WMSL 750-753.  The MK 20 Mod 0 Electro-Optical Sighting System (EOSS) is procured for the National Security Cutter, (NSC) hulls WMSL 754-760 and the Offshore Patrol Cutter (OPC).  These sighting systems are components of the MK48 Gun Weapon System (GWS) and provide fire control optical daytime and thermal imaging (infrared) sensor, and laser range finding to support engagements of hostile surface and air targets.

[P40A / CG006 COMBAT SYSTEM INTEGRATION]: Ensures successful integration and system interoperability of Navy type equipment that affects the Combat System of USCG NSCs (WMSLs), FRCs (WPCs), OPC (WMSMs), and the 270' Medium Endurance Cutter (WMEC) modernization effort.

[P40A / CG007 MULTI-MODE RADAR]: MMR will provide Air Surveillance, Surface Surveillance, GWS support and IFF Antenna functions for Offshore Patrol Cutter (OPC) and Polar Security Cutter (PSC).

[P40A / CG008 ATHENA CCD]: ATHENA Control, Correlation & Display (CCD) System for the OPC.  The ATHENA CCD uses existing AEGIS BSL 9, Common Source Library (CSL) code to control and display MMR and IFF data.  The systems will also provide target queuing for Gun Weapon System engagement.

FY2017-2018 ATHENA Combat System Control and Display integration supports software upgrade and hardware/software integration of the Technical Insertion (TI)-16 Common Display System for the MMR and IFF to provide data to the AN/SLQ-32(V)6 and the MK48 Gun Weapon System for target engagement on the Offshore Patrol Cutter (OPC), aka the Maritime Security Cutter, Medium (WMSM).  Includes safety, certification, technical documentation, and information assurance efforts.

[P40A / OPC C4I]: Funds are required for the procurement of Command, Control, Communications, Computers, and Intelligence (PEO C4I) for the new OPC Class, the Coast Guard's highest acquisition priority.  Under inter-service agreement, the Navy budgets for specific Navy military equipment, systems and logistic support requirements for Coast Guard units to ensure the Coast Guard is prepared to execute naval warfare tasks in consonance with US Navy units.  Ship construction and installation costs are funded under the Department of Homeland Security appropriation.  Specific C4I systems to be procured include: AN/SRC-65 VHF/UHF Line of Sight Satellite Communication, ARC-210 Radios (Qty 11 per hull); OE-570D Antenna Qty (1); Navy Modular Automated Communications System (AN/SYQ-26) Qty (2);CRYPTO Qty (1); OA-9277A Antenna Coupler Qty (2); and Command and Control Processor (C2P) AN/UYQ-120 Qty (2).

Justification.val:
Funding and inter-service agreement are used to procure Navy-Type/Navy-Owned (NT/NO) combat systems, support equipment, Integrated Logistics Support (ILS), certification, test and production support for USCG National Security Cutter (WMSL Class), Fast Response Cutter (WPC Class) and Offshore patrol Cutter (WMSM Class) being constructed under the Coast Guard's Surface Asset Acquisition Program. Funding also supports C4I systems and associated logistic support for the Offshore Patrol Cutter. These efforts are ongoing. 

FY 2021 funds provide AN/SPQ-9B ILS support for WMSLs; procure IFF AN/APX-123(V) equipment, ILS and certification support for WPCs; procure IFF UPX-29A equipment, INCO spares, and ILS support for WMSMs and WSMLs; support IFF ILS and multi-year certifications for WMSL; procure MK53 MOD 10 DLS for WMSM and WMSL; procure the EOSS for the WMSM; provide combat system integration for WMSLs, WPCs, and WMSMs; procure the Multi-mode Radar for the WMSM program; provide WMSM combat system integration of the Technical Insertion (TI)-16 Common Display System and integration support for the ATHENA Control Correlation and Display (CCD) System; AN/SRC-65 VHF/ UHF Line of Sight Satellite Communication ARC-210 Radios; OE-570D Antenna; Navy Modular Automated Communications System (AN/SYQ-26); CRYPTO; OA-9277A Antenna Coupler and Command and Control Processor (C2P) AN/UYQ-120.

Name.@footnote: FY2020 through FY2025 funding for AN/SPQ-9B system engineering, radar performance evaluation, test and evaluation, planning and support for WMSL (NSC) Class. Minor cost increase in FY2020 and inclusion of ILS support through the FYDP to fund previously unfunded requirement for successful SPQ-9B introduction and certification on WMSL (NSC) class hulls.
Provides the AN/SPQ-9B radar for the Maritime Security Cutter, Large (WMSL) Class, aka the National Security Cutter, to track surface targets and low fliers in support of potential gun engagements.

FiscalYear.@footnote: Contract awarded late July 2018 by PEO IWS 2R. SPQ-9B ordered for WMSL (NSC) 758-759 (NSC Hulls 9 and 10).

Name.@footnote: IFF Equipment suite for the WPC consists of MK XII equipment, Radar Control Transmitter (RCU), Radar Receiver-Transmitter shipping and installation fixtures which have various unit costs.  The IFF AIMS Equipment unit price is an average unit cost for the various components being procured that year.
IFF Equipment suite for the OPC consists of the RT-1912C, C-12720, AS-177B, AN/APX-123 KIT, AN/UPX-41(C), AN/USM-719, KIV-78 and INCO spares with various unit costs.
IFF UPX-29A WMSM item name corrected to IFF UPX-46 WMSM
IFF UPX-46 must be integrated with the WMSM (OPC) AEGIS B/L 9G. Budget reflects the portion of costs allocated by the Program Office for the combined contractor and government integration effort.
MK53 MOD 6/10 DLS OPC per unit cost has achieved a minor cost savings for FY2020 and the following years.

Funding increase in FY2020 is due to addition of 1.1 FTEs to support planned Integration and Testing for the WMSM (OPC) Class at NSWC Port Hueneme. This additional ILS/TEST Support is required to keep pace with the increase in procurement quantities.
Funding increase in FY2020 due to addition of 0.5 FTE to address WMSL equipment integration and testing requirements for the new optical sight.
Non-recurring engineering effort for the integration of the IFF Mode 5 on new construction cutters.
Non-recurring engineering effort for the integration of the SLQ-32 (V6) on new construction cutters.

FY2020 is the start of two (2) MMR procurements per year for the OPC program. One (1) additional MMR is required as a training asset in FY2020. Additional MMR procurements for the PSC program begin in FY2022.

FiscalYear.@footnote: MFG List's Procurement Lead Time  for this order is approximately 15 months, with scheduled delivery of 2020-06.
MFG List's Procurement Lead Time  for this order is approximately 15 months, with scheduled delivery of 2021-06.
MFG List's Procurement Lead Time  for this order is approximately 15 months, with scheduled delivery of 2022-06.

Name.@footnote: The Multi-Mode Radar (MMR) integration efforts include the software upgrade to correlate radar video tracks and IFF information and the detail design of the IFF antenna onto the MMR antenna hardware integration to include drawing updates and technical publications.

FY 2020 MMR ILS/TEST SUPPORT costs are attributable to the installation costs of the Multi-Mode Radar (MMR) in FY 2020. Each MMR delivery has an associated installation cost separate from the baseline ILS/TEST SUPPORT that supports the MMR Program, beginning in  the first year of delivery (FY 2019).

The Combat System Control and Display OPC integration supports hardware and software integration of the Technical Insertion (TI)-16 Common Display System for the Multi-Mode Radar, IFF and to provide data to the MK48 Gun Weapon System for target engagement.  Includes safety, certification, technical documentation, and information assurance efforts.  FY 2020 through FY 2023 increase attributable to the required addition of AEGIS Technical Representative support, Combat System Engineering and Integration support, and continued Combat System Integration efforts by the contractor to maintain and update the Athena (AEGIS Baseline 9G) CCD program.  FY 2021 increase is also attributable, in part, to new Athena integration efforts required up front for the Polar Security Cutter (PSC) program.

FY 2021 increase attributable to one (1) additional TI-16 CPS/CDSs system for the first Polar Security Cutter (PSC) hull. This is in addition to the annual purchase of the TI-16 CPS/CDS system for the Offshore Patrol Cutter (OPC).

No associated equipment installation costs are incurred across the FYDP. USCG will fund the installation of the C4I systems.  Procurements provide assets for OPC Hulls #1 through Hull #9 across the FYDP.
FY19 C2P contract award moved from June 2019 to March 2020 due to production delays. FY20 contract is still on track to award in June 2020.
Each ARC-210 system requires 11 radios. In FY20, USCG starts to build two OPC hulls per year. Procuring 22 radios for two ARC-210 systems each year starting with OPC 4 & 5 in FY20.
FY 2021 unit cost increase for the OE-570D due to new procurement contract.
